test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T10:00Z]: The patient was discharged after scoliosis surgery on December 15, 2024, but returned on December 30, 2024, with erythema and purulent drainage from the surgical site. Antibiotic prophylaxis was not appropriately documented prior to discharge.

required_provenance: erythema and purulent drainage from the surgical site
Antibiotic prophylaxis was not appropriately documented prior to discharge

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain after discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T11:00Z]: The patient was readmitted on January 1, 2025, for uncontrolled pain. The pain management plan post-discharge was inadequate and did not account for the patient's complex pain needs.

required_provenance: readmitted on January 1, 2025, for uncontrolled pain

test_cases.description: Patient delayed in surgery due to missed antibiotic redosing.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T09:00Z]: The patient was scheduled for surgery at 10 AM, but the antibiotic redosing was missed, causing a delay in the start time. This was documented in the OR notes.

required_provenance: the antibiotic redosing was missed, causing a delay in the start time

test_cases.description: Patient exhibiting signs of pain out of proportion to injury post-scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T08:00Z]: On POD 1, the patient reported significant pain that was out of proportion to the expected postoperative discomfort. A thorough examination was performed, and additional imaging was ordered to rule out complications.

required_provenance: significant pain that was out of proportion to the expected postoperative discomfort
additional imaging was ordered to rule out complications

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted for urinary tract infection after scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T11:00Z]: The patient was readmitted on POD 12 with complaints of dysuria and increased urinary frequency. Evaluation revealed a urinary tract infection, which may have been preventable with better preoperative urinary management.

required_provenance: readmitted on POD 12 with complaints of dysuria and increased urinary frequency
may have been preventable with better preoperative urinary management

test_cases.description: Patient developed a surgical site infection post-operation due to improper antibiotic prophylaxis.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T08:30Z]: During the post-operative review, the patient exhibited signs of a surgical site infection. It was noted that antibiotic prophylaxis was not administered within the required 60-minute window prior to incision, which likely contributed to the infection.

required_provenance: antibiotic prophylaxis was not administered within the required 60-minute window prior to incision

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain post-discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T09:15Z]: The patient returned to the emergency department three days after discharge complaining of uncontrolled pain. The pain management plan was insufficiently communicated at discharge, leading to this readmission.

required_provenance: uncontrolled pain

test_cases.description: Post-operative protocols not followed, leading to prolonged operative time.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T11:00Z]: The surgical team did not adhere to the preoperative warming protocol, which is documented as a standard practice. This deviation likely contributed to the prolonged operative time observed during the procedure.

required_provenance: did not adhere to the preoperative warming protocol

test_cases.description: Patient showed signs of passive stretch pain during recovery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T10:45Z]: During the recovery assessment, the patient experienced passive stretch pain. This indicates a potential issue with the surgical site that should have been monitored more closely to prevent further complications.

required_provenance: experienced passive stretch pain

test_cases.description: Post-operative wound drainage with erythema noted in follow-up visit.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T14:00Z]: At the follow-up visit, the patient exhibited wound drainage and erythema, which are indicators of potential infection. The initial post-operative care plan lacked adequate infection prevention strategies.

required_provenance: exhibited wound drainage and erythema

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-01T14:00Z]: Patient was discharged on post-operative day 3 but returned to the emergency room with complaints of uncontrolled pain. Pain management was inadequate prior to discharge, and a review of the chart reveals minimal follow-up on analgesic requirements, resulting in readmission.

required_provenance: uncontrolled pain

test_cases.description: Failure to perform pre-op warming protocol led to complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-02T09:30Z]: During the surgical procedure, it was noted that pre-operative warming was not documented. The patient developed hypothermia during surgery, which prolonged recovery time and increased the risk of post-operative infections.

required_provenance: pre-operative warming was not documented

test_cases.description: Patient exhibited signs of increasing analgesic requirement.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-03T11:15Z]: On post-operative day 1, the patient began to show signs of increasing analgesic requirement, suggesting inadequate pain control. This signal raised concerns about potential underlying issues that were not addressed prior to discharge.

required_provenance: increasing analgesic requirement

test_cases.description: Improper antibiotic prophylaxis increases infection risk.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-04T13:00Z]: The surgical team failed to administer antibiotic prophylaxis within the recommended 60 minutes prior to incision. Post-operative day 5, the patient developed a surgical site infection, indicating a clear failure in infection prevention protocols.

required_provenance: failed to administer antibiotic prophylaxis within the recommended 60 minutes

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to pneumonia after discharge.

[MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Upon further assessment, there are no signs of infection or erythema at the surgical site, and the wound appears well-healed.

required_provenance: showed signs of infection at the surgical site with erythema and drainage
no signs of infection or erythema at the surgical site

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding readmission risks post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-01T11:00Z]: Patient experienced postoperative nausea and vomiting, leading to a risk of readmission due to dehydration.

[MD 2025-01-02T08:00Z]: The patient reports no nausea or vomiting and is tolerating oral intake well, reducing the risk of readmission.

required_provenance: experienced postoperative nausea and vomiting, leading to a risk of readmission due to dehydration
reports no nausea or vomiting and is tolerating oral intake well

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding compliance with bundle protocols.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-01T12:00Z]: Preoperative warming was not documented in the patient's chart, indicating a deviation from standard bundle compliance.

[MD 2025-01-02T07:00Z]: The surgical team confirmed that preoperative warming was performed and documented, adhering to the compliance protocols.

required_provenance: Preoperative warming was not documented in the patient's chart
preoperative warming was performed and documented

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding safety signals post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-01T13:00Z]: Patient presented with increasing analgesic requirement, indicating potential pain out of proportion to injury.

[MD 2025-01-02T06:00Z]: The patient is managing pain well with current analgesics and shows no signs of pain out of proportion to injury.

required_provenance: presented with increasing analgesic requirement, indicating potential pain out of proportion to injury
is managing pain well with current analgesics and shows no signs of pain out of proportion to injury

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding infection risks and antibiotic prophylaxis.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-01T14:00Z]: Antibiotic prophylaxis was not given within 60 minutes prior to incision, increasing the risk of surgical site infection.

[MD 2025-01-02T05:00Z]: Records indicate that antibiotic prophylaxis was administered correctly within the time frame prior to surgery, mitigating infection risks.

required_provenance: Antibiotic prophylaxis was not given within 60 minutes prior to incision
antibiotic prophylaxis was administered correctly within the time frame prior to surgery

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding the patient's post-operative pain management leading to readmission.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T08:00Z]: The patient was discharged with controlled pain levels, indicating effective pain management. The family reported no concerns.

[Nurse 2025-01-03T14:00Z]: Patient returned to the ER with uncontrolled pain requiring readmission. Pain management plan was inadequate as per the caregiver's report.

required_provenance: controlled pain levels, indicating effective pain management
uncontrolled pain requiring readmission

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes about the use of antibiotic prophylaxis during surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[Surgeon 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Antibiotic prophylaxis was administered within the required timeframe prior to incision.

[Pharmacist 2025-01-03T15:00Z]: Review of surgical records indicates that prophylactic antibiotics were not given within 60 minutes of the incision.

required_provenance: Antibiotic prophylaxis was administered within the required timeframe
prophylactic antibiotics were not given within 60 minutes of the incision

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding infection risk factors post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T12:00Z]: Surgical site was clean with no signs of infection at the time of discharge.

[Infection Control 2025-01-03T17:00Z]: Patient returned with signs of surgical site infection, including erythema and drainage.

required_provenance: no signs of infection at the time of discharge
signs of surgical site infection, including erythema and drainage

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding the patient's nutritional status post-discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T13:00Z]: Patient was stable with adequate nutritional intake and no concerns about feeding.

[Dietitian 2025-01-03T18:00Z]: Patient shows signs of nutritional failure, including weight loss and decreased appetite since discharge.

required_provenance: adequate nutritional intake and no concerns about feeding
signs of nutritional failure, including weight loss and decreased appetite

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding pre-op warming compliance.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-01T10:00Z]: Patient underwent preoperative warming as per protocol.

[RN 2025-01-01T11:00Z]: Pre-op warming not documented in the chart.

required_provenance: Patient underwent preoperative warming as per protocol.
Pre-op warming not documented in the chart.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes on pain assessment post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T12:00Z]: Patient reports pain at the surgical site, managed with analgesics.

[RN 2025-01-02T13:00Z]: No significant pain reported during post-op assessment.

required_provenance: Patient reports pain at the surgical site, managed with analgesics.
No significant pain reported during post-op assessment.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding antibiotic prophylaxis.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-03T09:00Z]: Antibiotic prophylaxis administered within 60 minutes prior to incision.

[Pharmacist 2025-01-03T10:00Z]: Antibiotic prophylaxis not given within 60 minutes.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes on post-op infection assessment.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-04T08:00Z]: No signs of surgical site infection noted during post-op rounds.

[RN 2025-01-04T09:00Z]: Patient shows signs of infection at surgical site, erythema present.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding DVT prophylaxis compliance.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-05T11:00Z]: DVT prophylaxis was administered as indicated post-operatively.

[RN 2025-01-05T12:00Z]: DVT prophylaxis missed for this patient.

required_provenance: DVT prophylaxis was administered as indicated post-operatively.
DVT prophylaxis missed for this patient.

test_cases.description: Patient with symptoms mimicking infection but with alternative diagnosis.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T11:00Z]: The patient presented with a fever and increased pain at the surgical site. Upon evaluation, no signs of surgical site infection were noted, and the fever was attributed to a viral illness rather than an infection.

required_provenance: no signs of surgical site infection were noted

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with respiratory distress unrelated to previous surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T14:00Z]: The patient was readmitted with respiratory distress due to an asthma exacerbation unrelated to the recent spinal surgery. There were no signs of pneumonia or other surgical complications.

required_provenance: unrelated to the recent spinal surgery

test_cases.description: Patient with compliance issues regarding post-operative care.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T09:00Z]: Post-operative follow-up revealed that the patient did not adhere to the post-operative dressing protocol. However, no signs of infection or complications were present.

required_provenance: did not adhere to the post-operative dressing protocol

test_cases.description: Patient showing signs of discomfort without identifiable cause.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T16:00Z]: The patient exhibited increasing discomfort and pain but no neurological deficits or other alarming signs. The pain was considered to be due to normal post-operative recovery.

required_provenance: no neurological deficits or other alarming signs

test_cases.description: Patient with elevated infection risk factors but no actual infection.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T12:00Z]: Despite the patient's complex medical history and several risk factors for infection, the surgical site remained clean and dry with no signs of infection.

required_provenance: the surgical site remained clean and dry with no signs of infection

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with unrelated respiratory issue after scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T12:00Z]: Patient was readmitted 35 days post-op for respiratory distress due to unrelated asthma exacerbation. No signs of surgical site infection or other complications were noted. Surgical recovery was as expected without any readmission risks related to the previous surgery.

required_provenance: respiratory distress due to unrelated asthma exacerbation

test_cases.description: Surgical patient with compliance issues regarding antibiotic prophylaxis.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T14:30Z]: The patient underwent scoliosis surgery but did not receive antibiotic prophylaxis in accordance with the protocol. The surgical team noted that the delay in administration occurred due to a misunderstanding of the pre-op checklist requirements.

required_provenance: did not receive antibiotic prophylaxis in accordance with the protocol

test_cases.description: Post-operative patient showing signs of pain not related to surgical procedure.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T09:15Z]: On day 4 post-op, the patient reported severe abdominal pain not consistent with the surgical site. After evaluation, it was determined that the pain was likely due to a pre-existing condition of chronic pancreatitis rather than any complications from the scoliosis surgery.

required_provenance: reported severe abdominal pain not consistent with the surgical site

test_cases.description: Scoliosis patient post-op experiencing unrelated infection.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T11:00Z]: The patient presented with a fever and cough 40 days after surgery. Evaluation revealed pneumonia unrelated to the surgical site, indicating that the surgical recovery was on track with no signs of surgical site infection.

required_provenance: revealed pneumonia unrelated to the surgical site

test_cases.description: Patient with post-op urinary retention with no surgical complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T15:45Z]: The patient experienced urinary retention on day 10 post-op. This was attributed to the use of narcotics for pain management rather than a complication from scoliosis surgery. There were no signs of urinary tract infection or other complications.

required_provenance: experienced urinary retention on day 10 post-op
